DJEMBES

Guinea Djembes

Carved by artisan djembe carver Alseny Camara of Conakry, Guinea, these djembes sound as beautiful as they look.
You'll find all the information you need on each djembe, including a demonstration video, on each djembe's page.

£420 The Ramanujan
£400 The Pascal
£390 The Maxwell
£380 The Pythagoras
£360 The Euclid
£450 The Escher

Mali Djembes

High quality, traditional wood shells from Bamako in the heart of southern Mali. Beautifully designed on the outside and perfectly carved on the inside, these are outstanding djembes.

Beginner and Intermediate Djembes

Found from across the UK and given a new lease of life in my workshop, these djembes are all pre-loved but have been bought back to as-new standard, using the same skill, expertise and care as the premium djembes. This is the perfect place to grab yourself an excellent sounding and looking djembe. You can hear how each djembe sounds in the demonstration video on each page.

£130 13" Tweneboa Ghanaian Djembe
£220 12.5" Iroko Ivory Coast Djembe
£160 13" Ghanaian Djembe - Red Tweneboa Wood
£270 13" Senegalese Djembe

The Archive

Gone, but not forgotten. These are the djembes that have recently been through The Drum Hut's workshop and out the other side. They now belong to a lucky djembefola out there somewhere, but if you see any features in these djembes that you'd like replicated in your own drum, get in touch and I'll see what can be done.

£420 The Sierpinski
£400 The Pascal
£450 The Escher
